avalancheActivity.comment: The wind will be moderate to strong. The prevalence of the avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses. In some cases the avalanches are quite large and can be released even by a single winter sport participant. This applies in particular on wind-loaded slopes above approximately 1800 m, and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example. As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation small and medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible, in particular in case of releases originating from steep sunny starting zones at low and intermediate altitudes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs and wet snow require caution.

snowpackStructure.comment: Over a wide area 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen since Wednesday above approximately 1200 m. The moderate wind will transport the snow. The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs will become increasingly prone to triggering. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular on sunny slopes at low and intermediate altitudes.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Little snow has fallen since Wednesday. The wind will be moderate to strong over a wide area. The prevalence of the avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses. Such avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in steep terrain at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls, where The sometimes deep wind slabs are lying on weak layers. Mostly the avalanches are medium-sized and can be released even by a single winter sport participant.
Small and medium-sized natural avalanches are possible, in particular in case of releases originating from steep starting zones that have retained the snow thus far.
Below approximately 2200 m from a snow sport perspective, insufficient snow is lying. Watch out for the numerous rocks hidden by the recent snow.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs and weakly bonded old snow represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: In particular at low and intermediate altitudes thus far only a little snow is lying. Towards its base, the snowpack consists of faceted crystals, especially on shady slopes. The sometimes moderate wind will transport the new snow. The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs will become increasingly prone to triggering. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular on sunny slopes at low and intermediate altitudes.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Over a wide area 10 to 20 cm of snow has fallen since Wednesday above approximately 1200 m. The wind will be moderate to strong over a wide area. The prevalence of the avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses. Such avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in steep terrain at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls, where The sometimes deep wind slabs are lying on weak layers. Mostly the avalanches are medium-sized and can be released even by a single winter sport participant.
As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation small and medium-sized moist loose snow avalanches are possible, in particular in case of releases originating from steep sunny starting zones that have retained the snow thus far.
Below approximately 2200 m from a snow sport perspective, insufficient snow is lying. Watch out for the numerous rocks hidden by the recent snow.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs and weakly bonded old snow represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment: In particular at low and intermediate altitudes thus far only a little snow is lying. Towards its base, the snowpack consists of faceted crystals, especially on shady slopes. The sometimes moderate wind will transport the new snow. The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs will become increasingly prone to triggering. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular on sunny slopes at low and intermediate altitudes.

avalancheActivity.comment:
10 to 15 cm of snow has fallen since Wednesday above approximately 1200 m. In all altitude zones from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

Watch out for the numerous rocks hidden by the recent snow.
avalancheActivity.highlights: In these regions only a little snow is lying.

snowpackStructure.comment: In all aspects thus far only a little snow is lying in all altitude zones.
